title: briefUpdatesBreakingOffshootNL

items.title: Hate them or not, Patriots fans want the glory back in Super Bowl LX
items.description: As Bostonians bemoan their long years of suffering without a Super Bowl win, rival fans gripe that Title Town has become Entitled Town.

items.title: Talks With U.S. Were ‘Good Start,’ Iran’s Foreign Minister Says
items.description: Abbas Araghchi, the minister, said the two sides had agreed to continue negotiations at a later date. The U.S. delegation had yet to comment.

items.title: Saalumarada Thimmakka Dies; Planted and Nurtured Thousands of Trees
items.description: Believed to be 113, she spent decades building an environmental legacy in India, inspired by her grief at being unable to conceive children.

items.title: In the Grip of Gangs, Haiti Faces a Government Leadership Vacuum
items.description: The tenure of a presidential council that has been running Haiti expires on Saturday. It’s unclear what will come next.
